SSH sessions originating from a user acc.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for SSH traffic (port 22). Correlate connections with user login events (Windows Event ID 4624/4625 if available or SSH logs). Identify sequences of successful SSH connections from a single source user/host to multiple destination hosts in a short time frame. Use correlation analysis to link user activity across different hosts and identify deviations from normal connection patterns per user.

Detection of an SSH agent socket file be.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) for processes accessing files or paths matching common SSH agent socket locations (e.g., /tmp/ssh-*/agent.*, although this is primarily Linux/macOS context). Identify instances where the process accessing the socket is not the legitimate user's expected SSH client or agent process. Look for entropy changes in process execution patterns or command line arguments associated with these events.
